snippet: The buses that were supposed to take prisoners to court never left the jail, apparently a result of a job action by correction officers angry over a trial of two guards charged with misconduct.
abstract: Dozens of New York City corrections buses scheduled to take prisoners to court remain on Rikers Island, grinding many criminal courts in city to near halt; slowdown is widely assumed to be result of anger among correction officers over trial in Bronx in which officers Kevin Gilkes and Louis Pinto Jr face charges they beat an inmate and falsified records to cover it up.
lead_paragraph: The buses that were supposed to take prisoners to court never left the jail, apparently a result of a job action by correction officers angry over a trial of two guards charged with misconduct.

headline.main: Inmate Buses Sit at Rikers; New York City Courts Stalled
headline.print_headline: Inmate Buses Sit at Rikers; Courts Stalled
